
An intern encrypted a secret with RSA, but accidentally chose a modulus from two Blum integers. Recover the hidden flag: 1711339265954336759251601426103780474684337859037084071012187069156086668401308339288854308180181311292668390101222039117814142738617901759093494229710958

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{woj0k2o4}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1711339265954336759251601426103780474684337859037084071012187069156086668401308339288854308180181311292668390101222039117814142738617901759093494229710958
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6479486463782272340743977590647447771664951525113997297812145712173999045474581005781519021245312884245759586072013604417894721982615117518022559072558997, e=4151223178171233447749522897159116922709178619875750960714161312797107757593162836082121645508056195785724571069096633691479014008686239861736972697404841
